page.title: 07CHAWTON LEISURE FACILITIES
page.content: Chawton has a cricket club which plays on land owned by the Knight family of Chawton House.The pitch, 100 metres E. of the school, has a delightful wooden pavilion with a thatched roof.Directly opposite the school is a public recreation ground set up by the parish council in 1979/80. It has a climbing frame, see-saw and swings. The Village Hall was built in 1920 and is run by a volunteer committee. Dances and parties, mainly for children, are organised. It is used by the Women's Institute for meetings and by the school for concerts. People from the Alton area also use the hall for wedding receptions and other gatherings. There is also a village Horticultural Society which holds an annual summer show.
